intro: Hydrangea opuloides var. belzonii, commonly known as the Belzoni hydrangea, is a species native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences that can range from white to pink or blue depending on soil pH. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical, with a glossy green surface and serrated edges. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a striking visual element to gardens and natural landscapes.
